newsitem.title: USA: Boykin buys 91-pct stake in Maryland hotel.
newsitem.headline: Boykin buys 91-pct stake in Maryland hotel.

text.p: Boykin Lodging Co said Thursday it agreed to buy a 91-percent stake in Maryland hotel from the owner for $27.3 million, after which it will lease the hotel back to the owner.

Boykin, a Cleveland-based hotel real estate investment trust, struck the deal with Davidson Hotel Company, a privately owned hotel management company, a part of an alliance that will be expanded, the two parties said in a news release.

Boykin is acquiring the stake in Marriott's Hunt Valley Inn in suburban Baltimore from Wilton Hill. Hill owns Davidson Hotel Co, currently the hotel's majority owner. After the sale, Davidson Hotel will lease and continue to the hotel. Boykin
and Davidson said they plan to use the partnership to acquire additional full-service commercial and resort hotels to be leased to Davidson.
